channel.title: Next Ten Words
channel.description: Next Ten Words focuses on in-depth analysis and critique of the personal technology industry. Every week Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, and guests go beyond the soundbite to the next ten words. And the ten after that.
channel.generator: Feeder 2.5.12(2294); Mac OS X Version 10.12.1 (Build 16B2327e) http://reinventedsoftware.com/feeder/

image.title: Apple Talk
image.description: Next Ten Words focuses on in-depth analysis and critique of the personal technology industry. Every week Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, and guests go beyond the soundbite to the next ten words. And the ten after that.

channel.itunes:author: Gartenberg, Ritchie
channel.itunes:subtitle: Next Ten Words focuses on in-depth analysis and critique of the personal technology industry. Every week Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, and guests go beyond the soundbite to the next ten words. And the ten after that.
channel.itunes:summary: Apple Talk focuses on in-depth industry analysis and critique of Apple and related companies. Every week Michael Gartenberg, Serenity Caldwell, Rene Ritchie, and guests dive deep into the latest news, biggest trends, and most important issues at the intersection of culture and personal technology.

item.title: Three photos down, with Ross Rubin
item.description: Industry analyst Ross Rubin joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to discuss Google’s new Photos features, Apple’s possible responses, the market for drones, Siri as a speaker *dock*, and more.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, Ross Rubin
item.itunes:subtitle: Industry analyst Ross Rubin joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to discuss Google’s new Photos features, Apple’s possible responses, the market for drones, Siri as a speaker *dock*, and more.
item.itunes:summary: Industry analyst Ross Rubin joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to discuss Google’s new Photos features, Apple’s possible responses, the market for drones, Siri as a speaker *dock*, and more.

item.title: 35: Father of Smartwatches, with Bill Geiser
item.description: Bill Geiser, who's worked on wearables from Microsoft Spot to Palm to Fossil to HP, talks to Gartenberg and Ritchie about the state of the modern wrist.
item.itunes:subtitle: Bill Geiser, who's worked on wearables from Microsoft Spot to Palm to Fossil to HP, talks to Gartenberg and Ritchie about the state of the modern wrist.
item.itunes:summary: Bill Geiser, who's worked on wearables from Microsoft Spot to Palm to Fossil to HP, talks to Gartenberg and Ritchie about the state of the modern wrist.

item.title: 34: Mr. Snell from California
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, Jason Snell

item.title: 33: Q2 2017, with Neil Cybart
item.description: Neil Cybart joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to discuss Apple’s Q2 2017 financial results, including iPhone in and outside of China, iPad mini vs. iPad large screen, Apple Watch and wearables as a business, and more.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, Neil Cybart
item.itunes:subtitle: Neil Cybart joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to discuss Apple’s Q2 2017 financial results, including iPhone in and outside of China, iPad mini vs. iPad large screen, Apple Watch and wearables as a business, and more.
item.itunes:summary: Neil Cybart joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to discuss Apple’s Q2 2017 financial results, including iPhone in and outside of China, iPad mini vs. iPad large screen, Apple Watch and wearables as a business, and more.

item.title: 32: MacBooks & Marathons, with Dana Wollman
item.description: Dana Wollman of Engadget joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to talk fitness trackers for athletes and the state of laptops.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, Dana Wollman
item.itunes:subtitle: Dana Wollman of Engadget joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to talk fitness trackers for athletes and the state of laptops.
item.itunes:summary: Dana Wollman of Engadget joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to talk fitness trackers for athletes and the state of laptops.

item.title: 31: Six messaging apps before lunch, with Matthew Panzarino
item.description: When did Apple know it had to change gears on Mac Pro, and will it have a similar moment of clarity with iMessage and making it multi-platform? Matthew Panzarino of TechCrunch joins Gartenberg and Ritchie for our first, regular, second-guessing show.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, Matthew Panzarino
item.itunes:subtitle: When did Apple know it had to change gears on Mac Pro, and will it have a similar moment of clarity with iMessage and making it multi-platform? Matthew Panzarino of TechCrunch joins Gartenberg and Ritchie for our first, regular, second-guessing show.
item.itunes:summary: When did Apple know it had to change gears on Mac Pro, and will it have a similar moment of clarity with iMessage and making it multi-platform? Matthew Panzarino of TechCrunch joins Gartenberg and Ritchie for our first, regular, second-guessing show.

item.title: 30: Surface vs. Mac, with Brian Hall
item.description: Brian Hall, currently of Doppler Laps, formerly VP of Microsoft Devices, joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to talk about Microsoft Surface and its position relative to Apple with creatives and pros.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, Brian Hall
item.itunes:subtitle: Brian Hall, currently of Doppler Laps, formerly VP of Microsoft Devices, joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to talk about Microsoft Surface and its position relative to Apple with creatives and pros.
item.itunes:summary: Brian Hall, currently of Doppler Laps, formerly VP of Microsoft Devices, joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to talk about Microsoft Surface and its position relative to Apple with creatives and pros.

item.title: 29: Follow the Mac Pro money, with Nilay Patel
item.description: Apple held a special summit to get word out about an all-new, all-modular Mac Pro… coming next year. But what did Apple know and when did they know it? Gartenberg, Ritchie, and special guest Nilay Patel of The Verge go beyond the soundbite with the Next Ten Words.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, Nilay Patel
item.itunes:subtitle: Apple held a summit to get word out about a new, all-modular Mac Pro… coming next year. But what did Apple know and when did they know it? Gartenberg, Ritchie, and special guest Nilay Patel of The Verge go beyond the soundbite with the Next Ten Words.
item.itunes:summary: Apple held a special summit to get word out about an all-new, all-modular Mac Pro… coming next year. But what did Apple know and when did they know it? Gartenberg, Ritchie, and special guest Nilay Patel of The Verge go beyond the soundbite with the Next Ten Words.

item.title: 28: Galaxy S8 vs. 'iPhone 8', with Lisa Hope King
item.description: Lisa Hope King of Cheddar.tv joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to talk about Samsung’s new Galaxy S8 and what it does — and does not — mean for Apple and the next iPhone.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, Lisa Hope King
item.itunes:subtitle: Lisa Hope King of Cheddar.tv joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to talk about Samsung’s new Galaxy S8 and what it does — and does not — mean for Apple and the next iPhone.
item.itunes:summary: Lisa Hope King of Cheddar.tv joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to talk about Samsung’s new Galaxy S8 and what it does — and does not — mean for Apple and the next iPhone.

item.title: 27: (Product) Red Devices, with Dan Moren
item.description: Apple has a new RED iPhone, non-Air iPad, spring watchbands, and Clips video app. Gartenberg, Ritchie, and special guest Dan Moren discuss what this means now — and for an April event.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, Dan Moren
item.itunes:subtitle: Apple has a new RED iPhone, non-Air iPad, spring watchbands, and Clips video app. Gartenberg, Ritchie, and special guest Dan Moren discuss what this means now — and for an April event.
item.itunes:summary: Apple has a new RED iPhone, non-Air iPad, spring watchbands, and Clips video app. Gartenberg, Ritchie, and special guest Dan Moren discuss what this means now — and for an April event.

item.title: 26: The competition, with Daniel Bader
item.description: Daniel Bader returns to the show to talk to Gartenberg and Ritchie about Mobile World Congress, the LG G6, state of mobile cameras, OLED, and the tablet market.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, Daniel Bader
item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel Bader returns to the show to talk to Gartenberg and Ritchie about Mobile World Congress, the LG G6, state of mobile cameras, OLED, and the tablet market.
item.itunes:summary: Daniel Bader returns to the show to talk to Gartenberg and Ritchie about Mobile World Congress, the LG G6, state of mobile cameras, OLED, and the tablet market.

item.title: 25: The new influencers
item.description: Gartenberg and Ritchie dive deeper into Apple's current relationship with creative pros, who the "new influences" might be, Lightning vs. USB-C, and what's in a name… or brand.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie
item.itunes:subtitle: Gartenberg and Ritchie dive deeper into Apple's current relationship with creative pros, who the "new influences" might be, Lightning vs. USB-C, and what's in a name… or brand.
item.itunes:summary: Gartenberg and Ritchie dive deeper into Apple's current relationship with creative pros, who the "new influences" might be, Lightning vs. USB-C, and what's in a name… or brand.

item.title: 24: Big Block of Cheese Day
item.description: In the grand tradition of the West Wing, Gartenberg and Ritchie have put a 2-ton block of cheese out in the foyer of the podcast for any and all listeners who may be hungry — or have questions about Apple. (And we are absolutely making a mental list of those who are snickering, and even as we speak we are preparing appropriate retribution…!)

item.itunes:subtitle: In the grand tradition of the West Wing, Gartenberg and Ritchie have put a 2-ton block of cheese out in the foyer of the podcast for any and all listeners who may be hungry — or have questions about Apple.

item.title: 23: Apple TV, with Jason Snell
item.description: Following up on Q1 2017, Gartenberg and Ritchie speak with special guest Jason Snell of Six Colors on Apple TV: What it was meant to be, what it ended up being, and where it goes from here.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Jason Snell, Rene Ritchie
item.itunes:subtitle: Following up on Q1 2017, Gartenberg and Ritchie speak with special guest Jason Snell of Six Colors on Apple TV: What it was meant to be, what it ended up being, and where it goes from here.

item.title: 22: Q1 2017, with Neil Cybart
item.description: Special guest Neil Cybart of Above Avalon joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to talk Apple's blockbuster Q1 2017 earnings and where the company goes from here.
item.itunes:subtitle: Special guest Neil Cybart of Above Avalon joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to talk Apple's blockbuster Q1 2017 earnings and where the company goes from here.
item.itunes:summary: Special guest Neil Cybart of Above Avalon joins Gartenberg and Ritchie to talk Apple's blockbuster Q1 2017 earnings and where the company goes from here.

item.title: 21: Artificially Intelligent, with Carolina Milanesi
item.description: Artificial Intelligence is the new, trendy marketing term but how intelligent are our devices and assistants? Gartenberg, Caldwell, Ritchie, and special guest Carolina Milanesi discuss Alexa, Siri, Google, Facebook, and more!
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Serenity Caldwell, Rene Ritchie, Carolina Milanesi
item.itunes:subtitle: Artificial Intelligence is the new, trendy marketing term but how intelligent are our devices and assistants? Gartenberg, Caldwell, Ritchie, and special guest Carolina Milanesi discuss Alexa, Siri, Google, Facebook, and more!

item.title: 20: Painting the target, with Chuq Von Rospach
item.description: Special guest Chuq Von Rospach joins Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie to discuss Apple’s 2016 report card, including shipping, Mac desktops, and exceeding expectations.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Serenity Caldwell, Rene Ritchie, Chuq Von Rospach
item.itunes:subtitle: Special guest Chuq Von Rospach joins Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie to discuss Apple’s 2016 report card, including shipping, Mac desktops, and exceeding expectations.
item.itunes:summary: Special guest Chuq Von Rospach joins Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie to discuss Apple’s 2016 report card, including shipping, Mac desktops, and exceeding expectations.

item.title: 19: Failure to ship
item.description: Apple was known for seldom pre-announcing and almost always shipping on time, so what’s going on with AirPods and Apple Watch and iPhone supply this year? Also, Microsoft comes gunning for MacBook Pro.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, Serenity Caldwell
item.itunes:subtitle: Apple was known for seldom pre-announcing and almost always shipping on time, so what’s going on with AirPods and Apple Watch and iPhone supply this year? Also, Microsoft comes gunning for MacBook Pro.
item.itunes:summary: Apple was known for seldom pre-announcing and almost always shipping on time, so what’s going on with AirPods and Apple Watch and iPhone supply this year? Also, Microsoft comes gunning for MacBook Pro.

item.title: 18: Death of the smartwatch, with Daniel Bader
item.description: Gartenberg, Ritchie, and special guest Daniel Bader talk about the state of the smartwatch: Android Wear 2.0 delays, Motorola 360 exists, Pebble buyouts, Apple Watch market, and more!
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie, Daniel Bader
item.itunes:subtitle: Gartenberg, Ritchie, and special guest Daniel Bader talk about the state of the smartwatch: Android Wear 2.0 delays, Motorola 360 exists, Pebble buyouts, Apple Watch market, and more!

item.title: 17: State of the Mobile
item.description: As 2016 comes to a close, Michael Gartenberg and Rene Ritchie discuss the state of Mobile across Microsoft and Google and their highest profile vendors, and Apple.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie
item.itunes:subtitle: As 2016 comes to a close, Michael Gartenberg and Rene Ritchie discuss the state of Mobile across Microsoft and Google and their highest profile vendors, and Apple.

item.title: 16: Apple S.W.O.T.
item.description: We’re splitting Gartenberg off into his own podcast and this is the pilot! Listen along as we break down Apple’s strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats going into the end of 2016!
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Rene Ritchie
item.itunes:subtitle: We’re splitting Gartenberg off into his own podcast and this is the pilot! Listen along as we break down Apple’s strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats going into the end of 2016!

item.title: 15: Apple Watch and fitness, with Liz Plosser
item.description: Apple's messaging around Watch Series 2 was fitness-focused, but how does it hold up, and is there really a market for it? Caldwell, Ritchie, and special guest Liz Plosser from Self Magazine discuss!
item.itunes:author: Serenity Caldwell, Rene Ritchie, Liz Plosser
item.itunes:subtitle: Apple's messaging around Watch Series 2 was fitness-focused, but how does it hold up, and is there really a market for it? Caldwell, Ritchie, and special guest Liz Plosser from Self Magazine discuss!
item.itunes:summary: Apple's messaging around Watch Series 2 was fitness-focused, but how does it hold up, and is there really a market for it? Caldwell, Ritchie, and special guest Liz Plosser from Self Magazine discuss!

item.title: 14: Missing Macs, with Ben Bajarin
item.description: Apple’s new MacBook has been updated in 2016, but the new MacBook Pros are nowhere to be found, and the Mac mini and Mac Pro haven’t seen updates in years. What’s going on with Apple’s Mac product lines? Gartenberg, Ritchie, and special guest Ben Bajarin discuss!
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Ben Bajarin, Rene Ritchie
item.itunes:subtitle: Apple’s new MacBook has been updated in 2016, but the new MacBook Pros are nowhere to be found, and the Mac mini and Mac Pro haven’t seen updates in years. What’s going on with Apple’s Mac product lines? Gartenberg, Ritchie, and Bajarin discuss!
item.itunes:summary: Apple’s new MacBook has been updated in 2016, but the new MacBook Pros are nowhere to be found, and the Mac mini and Mac Pro haven’t seen updates in years. What’s going on with Apple’s Mac product lines? Gartenberg, Ritchie, and special guest Ben Bajarin discuss!

item.title: 13: Smile time
item.description: iPhone 7 has launched and Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie talk demand forecasting, messaging, media reception, gates, fumbles, and exceeding expectations.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Serenity Caldwell, Rene Ritchie
item.itunes:subtitle: iPhone 7 has launched and Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie talk demand forecasting, messaging, media reception, gates, fumbles, and exceeding expectations.
item.itunes:summary: iPhone 7 has launched and Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie talk demand forecasting, messaging, media reception, gates, fumbles, and exceeding expectations.

item.title: 12: The media is the iPhone message
item.description: iPhone 7 removed the headphone jack and added a two lens camera system, but how well did they sell them on the event stage? Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie explore the spin!
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Serenity Caldwell, Rene Ritchie
item.itunes:subtitle: iPhone 7 removed the headphone jack and added a two lens camera system, but how well did they sell them on the event stage? Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie explore the spin!
item.itunes:summary: iPhone 7 removed the headphone jack and added a two lens camera system, but how well did they sell them on the event stage? Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie explore the spin!

item.title: 11: iPhone upgrade pressure
item.description:
Are modern iPhones, iPads, and Macs 'good enough' that the mainstream — and perhaps even early-adopters — no longer feel the need to update? Gartenberg thinks they might be, Ritchie thinks there's lots more to come, and Caldwell... no spoilers, listen along!

Show notes

  • Bored now
  • Oh no! My current iPhone might be 'good enough'
  • Why stop with the headphone jack? Apple could delete everything!
  • iPhone 7 rumor roundup

Hosts

  • Michael Gartenberg
  • Serenity Caldwell
  • Rene Ritchie

Feedback

Send in your comments, questions, feedback, or follow-up to:

  • Email: appletalk@imore.com
  • Twitter: @iMore with hashtag #appletalk or yell at the hosts directly.
    a

item.title: 10: The iPad story
item.description: What's the iPad story? Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie discuss the narratives Apple has — and hasn't — used to not only sell iPads, but sell the *idea* of iPads.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Serenity Caldwell, Rene Ritchie
item.itunes:subtitle: What's the iPad story? Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie discuss the narratives Apple has — and hasn't — used to not only sell iPads, but sell the *idea* of iPads.
item.itunes:summary: What's the iPad story? Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie discuss the narratives Apple has — and hasn't — used to not only sell iPads, but sell the *idea* of iPads.

item.title: 09: Unpacking Pokemon Go
item.description: With the success of Pokémon Go, the enormity of the mobile market has been made shockingly clear. Confluence of technologies? Nostalgia and brand power? Thirst for distraction? Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Caldwell discuss what lessons can be learned and what'll come next.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Serenity Caldwell, Rene Ritchie
item.itunes:subtitle: With the success of Pokémon Go, the enormity of the mobile market has been made shockingly clear. Confluence of technologies? Nostalgia and brand power? Thirst for distraction? What lessons can be learned and what'll come next.
item.itunes:summary: With the success of Pokémon Go, the enormity of the mobile market has been made shockingly clear. Confluence of technologies? Nostalgia and brand power? Thirst for distraction? Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Caldwell discuss what lessons can be learned and what'll come next.

item.title: 08: The next iPhone, with Neil Cybart
item.description:
Apple's job is to make better iPhones so more people buy them faster. How does a tick, tock, tock design cycle, and removing the headphone jack fit into that? Gartenberg, Caldwell, Ritchie, and special guest Neil Cybart discuss.

Show notes

  • Apple Unlikely to Make Big Changes for Next iPhone
  • iPhone Warning Signs
  • We don't know jack about the next iPhone
  • iPhone 7 and making Lightning strike twice
  • Imagining an iPod in your ears
  • Tick-tock... tock?!—The future of iPhone product cycles
  • Above Avalon Memberships

Guests

  • Neil Cybart

Hosts

  • Michael Gartenberg
  • Serenity Caldwell
  • Rene Ritchie

Feedback

Send in your comments, questions, feedback, or follow-up to:

  • Email: appletalk@imore.com
  • Twitter: @iMore with hashtag #appletalk or yell at the hosts directly.

item.title: 07: WWDC 2016 aftermath
item.description: WWDC 2016 has come and gone, and Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie break it all down. From watchOS 3 to tvOS 10, macOS Sierra to iOS 10, here's what it all means… and portends.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Serenity Caldwell, Rene Ritchie
item.itunes:subtitle: WWDC 2016 has come and gone, and Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie break it all down. From watchOS 3 to tvOS 10, macOS Sierra to iOS 10, here's what it all means… and portends.

item.title: 06: App Store economy, with Ben Bajarin
item.description:
Faster review times, subscriptions for every category, and search ads are the latest additions to the App Store, and special guest Ben Bajarin joins Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie to discuss how much — or how little — that may help the App Store economy.

Show notes

  • App Store FAQ: What developers and customers need to know!
  • The New App Store: Subscription Pricing, Faster Approvals, and Search Ads
  • Phil Schiller: Apple making major changes to the App Store
  • APP STORE 2.0
  • Techpinions

Guests

  • Ben Bajarin

Hosts

  • Michael Gartenberg
  • Serenity Caldwell
  • Rene Ritchie

Feedback

Send in your comments, questions, feedback, or follow-up to:

  • Email: appletalk@imore.com
  • Twitter: @iMore with hashtag #appletalk or yell at the hosts directly.

item.title: 05: Virtual reality distortion, with Jan Dawson
item.description:
Gartenberg, Caldwell, Ritchie, and special guest Jan Dawson chat Apple and Virtual Reality, first mover advantages, mainstream adoption, gaming culture, and fear of missing out.

Show notes

    • Apple hires top virtual reality researcher Doug Bowman
    • Apple building massive team for virtual reality research
    • Apple's Route to Virtual Reality
    • Apple's Slow, Subtle Build to New Products
    • Apple lives in a real world, not a virtual one
    • Apple and making the virtual a reality
    • VRHeads.com

    Guests

    • Jan Dawson

    Hosts

    • Michael Gartenberg
    • Serenity Caldwell
    • Rene Ritchie

    Feedback

    Send in your comments, questions, feedback, or follow-up to:

    • Email: appletalk@imore.com
    • Twitter: @iMore with hashtag #appletalk or yell at the hosts directly.

item.title: 04: Firing the digital assistants, with Carolina Milanesi
item.description:
Gartenberg, Ritchie, and special guest Carolina Milanesi of Creative Strategies chat about Alexa, Siri, Google, digital agents, virtual assistants, personalities, API, internationalization, utility, and more.

Show notes

  • Should Virtual Assistants Be Humanized?
  • Alexa: A Short and Passionate Affair or A Long Standing Relationship?
  • Siri vs. Alexa is hilarious to people outside the U.S.
  • Could Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning be Apple's BlackBerry moment?
  • It's a bot, bot, bot world. Also, Apple is doomed!
  • If Google's right about AI, that's a problem for Apple

Guests

  • Carolina Milanesi

Hosts

  • Michael Gartenberg
  • Rene Ritchie

Feedback

Send in your comments, questions, feedback, or follow-up to:

  • Email: podcast@imore.com
  • Twitter: @iMore with hashtag #appletalk or yell at the hosts directly.

item.title: 03: Apple Car as a service, with Horace Dediu
item.description:
Gartenberg, Caldwell, Ritchie and special guest Horace Dediu of Asymco chat about Apple's investment in Didi Chuxing, Project Titan, and what a car business from Apple might—and might not—look like.

Guests

  • Horace Dediu

Hosts

  • Michael Gartenberg
  • Serenity Caldwell
  • Rene Ritchie

  • Twitter: @iMore with hashtag #appletalk or yell at the hosts directly.
item.itunes:author: Michael Gartenberg, Serenity Caldwell, Rene Ritchie, and Horace Dediu
item.itunes:subtitle: Gartenberg, Caldwell, Ritchie and special guest Horace Dediu of Asymco chat about Apple's investment in Didi Chuxing, Project Titan, and what a car business from Apple might—and might not—look like.
item.itunes:summary: Gartenberg, Caldwell, Ritchie and special guest Horace Dediu of Asymco chat about Apple's investment in Didi Chuxing, Project Titan, and what a car business from Apple might—and might not—look like.

item.title: 02: Betting against Apple Pay, with Daniel Bader
item.description:
Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie are joined by Daniel Bader to discuss the challenges Apple Pay faces when it comes to global expansion and consumer adoption.

Show notes

  • Apple Pay expands to Big Five banks in Canada with support for Visa, MasterCard and Interac
  • Canadian banks, including 'the Big Five,' sign on for major Apple Pay expansion
  • Apple Pay-led surge in ANZ card customers drives rival banks to renegotiate
  • Cabinet approves Apple Pay's introduction in Taiwan
  • Kohl's Charge and Yes2You Rewards Now Easy as One Tap in Apple Pay
  • Apple Pay on the web/in browsers in iOS 10/OS X 10.12

Guests

  • Daniel Bader

Hosts

  • Michael Gartenberg
  • Serenity Caldwell
  • Rene Ritchie

Feedback

Send in your comments, questions, feedback, or follow-up to:

  • Email: podcast@imore.com
  • Twitter: @iMore with hashtag #appletalk or yell at the hosts directly.

item.itunes:subtitle: Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie are joined by Daniel Bader to discuss the challenges Apple Pay faces when it comes to global expansion and consumer adoption.
item.itunes:summary: Gartenberg, Caldwell, and Ritchie are joined by Daniel Bader to discuss the challenges Apple Pay faces when it comes to global expansion and consumer adoption.

item.title: 01: State of the iPhone, with John Gruber
item.description:
Welcome to Apple Talk, a new podcast from iMore. Apple Talk focuses on in-depth industry analysis and critique of Apple and related companies. Every show, Michael Gartenberg, Serenity Caldwell, Rene Ritchie, and guests dive deep into the most important story of the week.

And it all starts with a look at Apple’s iPhone business with special guest Mr. John Gruber of Daring Fireball.

Show notes

  • This is Tim: Apple's CEO on the company's 2016 Q2 earnings
  • iPhone warning signs
  • Doubting the iPhone revisited (Paywall)
  • Apple and the Terrible, Horrible, No Good, Very Bad Drop in iPhone Sales
  • What does Apple look like without the iPhone?
  • After iPhone
  • Apple's best days behind it'... again

Guests

  • John Gruber

Hosts

  • Michael Gartenberg
  • Serenity Caldwell
  • Rene Ritchie

Feedback

Send in your comments, questions, feedback, or follow-up to:

  • Email: podcast@imore.com
  • Twitter: @iMore with hashtag #appletalk or yell at the hosts directly.

item.itunes:summary:
Welcome to Apple Talk, a new podcast from iMore. Apple Talk focuses on in-depth industry analysis and critique of Apple and related companies. Every show, Michael Gartenberg, Serenity Caldwell, Rene Ritchie, and guests dive deep into the most important story of the week.
And it all starts with a look at Apple’s iPhone business with special guest Mr. John Gruber of Daring Fireball.
